ways: What are the Intended Learning Outcomes of Mathematics?
What are the ILOs of Mathematics?
Give the Intended Learning Outcomes of Mathematics?
responses:
Define the basic concepts of set theory and to identify real numbers in a more insightful manner, and perform algebra on complex numbers in Cartesian, and polar and forms 
Apply the principles of Vector on the plane to space and derive the equations of line and plane in vector form, 
Explain the concepts of a function of several variables and compute the derivatives of multivariable function, 
 Identify the sequence and infinite series, discuss the convergence, and obtain the power series expansion of certain functions, 
Discuss the least square errors methods to find the curve of best fit and explain its accuracy

ways: What are the course contents of Mathematics?
Give the course contents of Mathematics?
What are the contents of Mathematics?
responses:
Basic Set Theory = 2 hours of lectures and 2 hours of Tutorial, 
Vectors in Euclidean Space = 2 hours of lectures and 2 hours of Tutorial, 
Functions of a Single Variable  = 6 hours of lectures and 4 hours of Tutorial, 
Sequences  = 5 hours of lectures and 2 hours of Tutorial, 
Infinite Series = 6 hours of lectures and 3 hours of Tutorial, 
Power Series   = 4 hours of lectures and 2 hours of Tutorial,
Complex Numbers   = 1 hours of lectures and 2 hours of Tutorial,
Functions of Several Variables = 7 hours of lectures and 4 hours of Tutorial,
Curve Fitting = 1 hours of lectures and 1 hours of Tutorial

ways: Intended Learning Outcomes of Engineering Drawing?
What are the Intended Learning Outcomes of Engineering Drawing?
What are the ILOs of Engineering Drawing?
Give the Intended Learning Outcomes of Engineering Drawing?
Give the ILOs of Engineering Drawing?
responses:
Describe standard drafting principles and theory of projection, 
Plot mechanical, architectural, and household wiring drawings at designated scales, 
Recognize underlying techniques behind engineering graphics, 
 Sketch objects freehand in 3-D, 
Prepare drawings using Computer Aided Drawing (CAD) software package

ways: What are the course contents of Engineering Drawing?

responses:
Fundamentals of Engineering Drawing  = 1 hour of lecture, 
Drawing in First and Third Angle Orthographic Projections, International Standards in Engineering Drawing Practice  = 1 hour of lecture and 10 hours of Practical, 
Mechanical, Architectural and Household Wiring Drawing  = 3 hours of lectures and 30 hours of Practical, 
Engineering Graphics   = 2 hours of lectures and 12 hours of Practical, 
Freehand Sketching  = 10 hours of Practical, 
 Fundamental Knowledge in Computer Aided Drawing  = 2 hours of lectures and 10 hours of Practical
